title: Fix Subject-to-Career AR Explorer module accessibility

requirements.summary: Create SubjectToCareer page component with AR Explorer placeholder content
acceptanceCriteria: New SubjectToCareer.tsx file exists in frontend/src/pages directory
Component includes a header with 'Subject-to-Career AR Explorer' title
Page displays an informative description about exploring career paths through subject connections
Component follows the same responsive design patterns as other pages (mobile-first, gradient backgrounds, card-based layout)
Page is accessible when navigating from the Modules page

file_operations.description: Create a new page component that displays the Subject-to-Career AR Explorer module. Include a header section with gradient background matching the design system (using bg-gradient-to-br from-purple-600 to-indigo-700 pattern). Add a descriptive section explaining how subjects connect to career paths and potential future careers. Include placeholder cards indicating AR features are coming soon with icons from frontend/public/assets/generated/icon-ar-explorer.dim_128x128.png. Follow the same responsive layout patterns as CareerPath.tsx and DegreeFinder.tsx with container max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 structure. Use card-based layout with rounded-xl shadow-lg styling consistent with other module pages.

requirements.summary: Add /subject-to-career route to App.tsx router configuration
acceptanceCriteria: Route '/subject-to-career' is registered in the router configuration in App.tsx
Route successfully renders the SubjectToCareer component
Navigation to /subject-to-career from any page works correctly
Browser back/forward buttons work correctly with this route

file_operations.description: Add a new route configuration for '/subject-to-career' path in the TanStack Router setup. Import the SubjectToCareer component from './pages/SubjectToCareer'. Add the route object following the same pattern as existing routes like career-path, stream-selector, and chatbot. Ensure the route is added to the routes array in the routeTree configuration so it's properly registered with the router.

requirements.summary: Update Modules page to wire Subject-to-Career card to correct route
acceptanceCriteria: The Subject-to-Career AR Explorer card in Modules.tsx includes path='/subject-to-career' prop
Clicking the 'Explore' button on the Subject-to-Career AR Explorer card navigates to /subject-to-career
The module card displays with the same styling and interaction pattern as other module cards
No console errors occur when clicking the module card

file_operations.description: Locate the ModuleCard component for 'Subject-to-Career AR Explorer' and update its path prop to '/subject-to-career'. Ensure the icon prop references the correct asset path frontend/public/assets/generated/icon-ar-explorer.dim_128x128.png. Verify the card follows the same pattern as other module cards with consistent title, description, and path structure.
